title: add camera flash mode option during syncing
body:
The current camera implementation does not really support flash mode as is in the figma designs. Consult with the following design to add camera flash mode

https://www.figma.com/file/Tf5nfkYvpbnNCo4rKLK7lS?node-id=1929:154137#429186829
@silenteyesoncode yeah but you might want to wait until https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/pull/16248 is merged as the issue with cameraKit is addressed here already.

Please assign me once the merge for #16248 is completed. Thank you!
@jo-mut

@silenteyesoncode - The PR (#16248) is merged. 

We highly appreciate your interest in contributing to Status.

You can start working on this issue, and I will assign this issue to you. 
Refer to our [docs](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/tree/develop/doc) for a quick start if required.

We appreciate your giving timely updates.

Thanks!

thank @smohamedjavid 
I'm on it

@smohamedjavid  do i need figma for this ?
if **yes** how can i get access , as the above link doesn't  work in description

@silenteyesoncode - I believe you don't need Figma. But, I will check if I can get you access and update you.


Meanwhile, the existing code has the flash button:

https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/blob/d91e67cae7fd85765389ab64b3ada202c815b771/src/status_im2/contexts/syncing/scan_sync_code/view.cljs#L178-L185

Feel free to run the app and check.
If the flash is on, you need to use the icon `:i/flashlight-on`.

hi @smohamedjavid - I need help setting up the IDE with vsCode - Also What branch should i use for my parent repo to make the changes ### [No file found in Status development](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/blob/develop/doc/ide-setup.md#start-and-connect-the-repl)

Hey @silenteyesoncode,

> I need help setting up the IDE with vsCode

Apologies for the `No file found` error. We will get the docs updated.

I'm adding the correct [Status development](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/blob/develop/doc/starting-guide.md#development) link here to unblock your progress.

Having Calva installed in VS Code should be fine (Step 0) for development. Connecting to project [REPL](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/blob/develop/doc/ide-setup.md#start-and-connect-the-repl) is needed if you want to perform any actions inside it.


> Also What branch should i use for my parent repo to make the changes

Please fork the repo and start with the `develop` branch.
@silenteyesoncode - Can you help me share your email address for the design access?

Sure, here you go @smohamedjavid 
7silenteyes07@gmail.com

@silenteyesoncode : you'll have to run the make commands in linux subsystem for windows OR (WSL)
also commands like `yarn` should not be run unless you're inside a `nix` shell, from the screenshot I can tell you're in a normal terminal.
Once you have WSL setup you would need to run 
`make run-clojure` then 
`make run-metro` then 
`make run-android` 
in this order in 3 different terminals for initial setup.

![Screenshot 2023-06-26 180208](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/46851135/d55eea10-5e13-4480-a6af-f77c80006cf1) hi @siddarthkay , i did install make and add the environment variable, but cannot run make , even the version. Can you please help me what i'm missing here

> what i'm missing here

WSL
Hey, @silenteyesoncode - Kindly keep us posted.

@smohamedjavid i couldn't make the necessary changes 
may be someone else can contribute here
